title: 105_s1794
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gulf War Veterans' Iraqi Claims Protection Act of 1998". Adjudication of claims is addressed in the Act. The United States Commission is authorized to receive and determine claims by U.S. nationals against Iraq, applying applicable law and principles of justice. Priority is given to non-commercial claims related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait and the attack on the USS Stark. The United States Commission is authorized to receive and determine claims by U.S. nationals against Iraq, prioritizing non-commercial claims related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait and the attack on the USS Stark. The International Claims Settlement Act provisions apply to claims under this Act. SEC. 3. CLAIMS FUNDS. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to establish the Iraq Claims Fund for payment of claims. Proceeds from Iraqi asset liquidation will be allocated by the President between the Iraq Claims Fund and other accounts for the payment of claims, subject to limitations. The Iraq Claims Fund is established for payment of claims, with limitations on the amount allocated for claims of the United States Government. The certified claims must be determined valid by the Secretary of State and certified under procedures set by the President. The President is authorized to vest and liquidate Iraqi assets in the US to satisfy claims under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. Reimbursement for administrative expenses will be deducted from the Iraq Claims Fund. Payments will be made according to established procedures. The United States Commission certifies awards under section 2, with payments made from the Iraq Claims Fund in order of priority. This includes a $10,000 payment or the principal amount of the award, additional payments for claims with priority, and subsequent payments based on the total amount available in the fund. After payments are made from the Iraq Claims Fund, any remaining funds will be transferred to the Treasury of the United States. Payment of awards under this Act does not extinguish unsatisfied claims against the Government of Iraq. SEC. 7. AUTHORITY TO TRANSFER RECORDS. The head of any Executive agency may transfer records to the United States Commission for adjudication. SEC. 8. STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS; DISPOSITION OF UNUSED FUNDS. The statute of limitations for payment on certified awards under this Act is one year after the publication date of the required notice. The Secretary of the Treasury must publish a notice in the Federal Register after 9 years, detailing the statute of limitations and identifying unpaid claims. Unused funds will be disposed of after a 2-year period. At the end of a 2-year period, the Secretary of the Treasury will dispose of any unused funds from the Iraq Claims Fund by depositing them into the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts if not used for additional payments. SEC. 9. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms used in the Act, including "Executive agency," "Government of Iraq," "United Nations Commission," and "United States Commission."
